greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,k), a triangular array read by rows, is the number of classes of equivalent 2-color n-bead necklaces (turning over is not allowed) that have k necklaces.
comment: Equivalently, the cyclic group of order n acts on the set of length n binary sequences.  T(n,k) is the number of orbits that have k elements.
link: F. Ruskey, Necklaces, Lyndon words, De Bruijn sequences, etc.
Frank Ruskey, Combinatorial Generation Algorithm Algorithm 4.24, p. 95.
mathematica: f[list_] := Sort[NestList[RotateLeft, list, Length[list]-1]]; Flatten[Table[Distribution[Map[Length, Map[Union, Union[Map[f, Strings[{0, 1}, n]]]]], Range[n]], {n, 1, 12}]]
xref: A000031 (row sums), T(n,n) = A001037, T(n,n) = A064535 when n is prime, T(n,k) = A001037(k) when k divides n.
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Jan 01 2012
